case_vignette: A 37-year-old man comes to the physician because of increasing swelling and pain of his right knee for the past month. He has not had any trauma to the knee or previous problems with his joints. He has hypertension. His only medication is hydrochlorothiazide. He works as a carpet installer. He drinks two to three beers daily. He is 170 cm (5 ft 7 in) tall and weighs 97 kg (214 lb); BMI is 33.6 kg/m2. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 88/min, and blood pressure is 122/82 mm Hg. Examination of the right knee shows swelling and erythema; there is fluctuant edema over the lower part of the patella. The range of flexion is limited because of the pain. The skin over the site of his pain is not warm. There is tenderness on palpation of the patella; there is no joint line tenderness. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having increasing swelling and pain in my right knee for the past month.
Have you experienced similar symptoms in any other joints?
No, I haven't had previous problems with my joints.
How old are you and what is your sex?
I'm a 37-year-old man.
Have you had any recent injuries or accidents that might affect your knee?
No, I haven't had any trauma to the knee.
Do you have any known allergies or are you currently taking any medications?
I don't have any known allergies, and the only medication I take is hydrochlorothiazide for my blood pressure.
Have you noticed any redness or warmth in the affected knee?
Yes, there's redness on the knee, but the skin over the painful area isn't warm.
Have you been experiencing any stiffness in the knee, especially in the morning? If so, how long does the stiffness last?
My knee has limited movement because it hurts, but I haven't mentioned anything about stiffness in the morning or how long it might last.
Has there been any fever, weight loss, or other systemic symptoms accompanying your knee pain and swelling?
No, I haven't experienced fever, weight loss, or other systemic symptoms.
Do you engage in activities that could contribute to overuse of the knee joint, such as running or jumping sports?
I work as a carpet installer, which doesn't involve running or jumping sports, but it does involve a lot of knee use.
Does your current job involve repetitive kneeling or squatting?
Yes, my job involves repetitive kneeling.
Is the knee pain affecting your ability to perform daily tasks or work?
Yes, the pain limits how much I can bend my knee.
Is there a family history of joint diseases, such as rheumatoid arthritis, psoriasis, or gout?
I haven't mentioned any family history of joint diseases.
Does the swelling in your knee appear to be localized in any particular area, like over the kneecap or on either side of the knee?
The swelling is over the lower part of the kneecap.
Have you noticed any locking, clicking, or giving way of the knee joint?
I haven't mentioned any locking, clicking, or giving way of the knee.
Final Diagnosis: Prepatellar bursitis (carpet layer's knee)
